articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken visits Egypt and Israel on Monday hoping to deliver the ceasefire that President Joe Biden proposed last month, in an all-out push by Washington to secure an end to the Gaza war.
articles.title: Blinken in Middle East to push ceasefire while Israeli troops advance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An aircraft carrying Malawi's Vice President Saulos Klaus Chilima and nine others has gone missing, Malawi's presidency said on Monday.
articles.title: Aircraft carrying Malawi vice president missing, presidency says

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: Talks to forge South Africa's post-election unity government will need to bring together parties with goals as contradictory as seizing white-owned farms and mines, ditching Black empowerment policies and tearing up the constitution.
articles.title: How can South Africa form a unity government from wildly different visions?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's opposition left-wing parties late on Monday pledged to work together and nominate joint candidates in snap parliament elections later this month to challenge the government and Marine Le Pen's far-right movement.
articles.title: French left-wing parties pledge to team up for snap elections

articles.author: Jack Queen, Tom Hals
articles.description: The evidence against U.S. President Joe Biden’s son was grim but established that he was guilty of making a false statement about his use of illegal drugs on a background check form when he bought a gun, a government lawyer told a jury on Monday.
articles.title: Hunter Biden evidence 'ugly,' prosecutors tell jury and urge conviction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Singapore Airlines has sent offers of compensation to passengers on board a flight last month that encountered severe turbulence that led to dozens of injuries and one death, the carrier said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Singapore Airlines offers compensation to passengers on severely turbulent flight

articles.author: Sabine Siebold, Maria Martinez
articles.description: Budget infighting within Germany's governing coalition is jeopardising its plan to meet defence commitments to Western allies even as tensions with Russia rise and a NATO-sceptic Donald Trump bids for a second term as U.S. president.
articles.title: Infighting over budget imperils Germany’s defence upgrade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak unveils his Conservatives' agenda for government on Tuesday, promising to offer voters in an election on July 4 the kind of financial security he says the opposition Labour Party can never provide.
articles.title: Under pressure, Britain's Sunak unveils party election manifesto

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four American educators from a small Iowa university were reportedly stabbed in a public park in northeast China's Jilin province over the weekend, according to U.S. media and U.S. government officials.
articles.title: Four American educators stabbed in park in northeast China, says US media and officials

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's military fired warning shots at the weekend after some North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the border, South Korea's military said, amid a recent rise in tension over Pyongyang's launch of balloons carrying trash into the South.
articles.title: South Korea fired warning shots at weekend after border incursion
